website_summaries.verdict: If you need a tire rack with a bit more capacity than 300 pounds, and you don't want to pay top dollar, this is a great middle-of-the-road pick.
pros: A mid-level model that's strong and adjustable from 36 to 68 inches
cons: Not as easy to install as other models if your studs don't line up to its dimensions

customer_reviews.title: Modified this as a floor tire rack (LoLoft?)
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a floor level tire storage rack and could not find one. Saw this and I thought ... "I could modify that to work as a floor rack." Before I get into the modification details, I should say that this product arrived in perfect condition and appears to be a sturdy unit. Now for the modification (see pics) ... Inverted the rack (such that mounting tabs were horizontal) and attached the tabs to two 2x4 skids. Additionally, added a 1x1 piece between the now upper area of the rack (to add some extra structural rigidity). Final outcome: Looks good (imho), appears functional, and is very solid (e.g., not at all flimsy). Works for me!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Bad Experience
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, both came with missing pieces and the quality of the product is very poor, a joint was bent and the welding was poor. The finish was bad, multiple areas with scraped off paint. I attached photos. I though I was getting a good deal, I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: acceptable product
customer_reviews.text: Received what appeared to be returned or repurposed product as was awkwardly and inconsistently repackaged. In addition instruction indicate was to have received two different size sets of tubing and a three sets were the same size. Also disappointed in slop between mating tubes should be tighter toleranced to reduce deflection. In addition replaced two inch long lag screws with three inch screws and put flat washers on lag screws to increase surface holding area. 1 1/2 inch engagement in to stud did not seem sufficient. Overall not a bad product. Will four large pick up tires now in rack that 40 pounds each. Appears to holding its own. Nice looking unit. Will repost if any changes. Would recommend product.
customer_reviews.author: Wisgerhof

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the butt to install
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan, it's up, it's holding the tires but what a chore. I've used another product (TireRack brand) and it's much better. The expandable tubes used for the back and to hold the tire seem very weak (they flex with small car tires) and make installation a pain (they spin and slide when installing). The lag bolts are a pain, but I knew that going into the install and had the proper tools to assist. If I'm ever in the market for another one, I'll be shopping for something besides this one. Just hope it holds up to the annual winter / spring tire swaps.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy But Wish The Instructions/Labeling Was Better
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to see that this arrived a day early. I immediately went to work putting this up in my garage. Easy to assemble and it’s very sturdy. My only complaint would be that it’s not easy to tell which tube is which. For instance, there are three large tubes but two of them are for the bottom and those two are a difference size than the one that goes on the back. The difference in the tubes is minimal. I measured them and am pretty sure I figured out which ones are which. I do like the tire rack and am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Where's My Washers?
customer_reviews.text: I actually have 3 of these now in my garage. They have been up for up to 7 years with no issues. I am deducting one star as on the last install a lot of washers (lock and flat) were not supplied but were called out in instructions. Manufacturer must anticipate this as they include a flyer that states if parts are missing to contact them and not return product. Might be better to improve your QC systems.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: Adequate Affordable Solution, Not Very Versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize this was up to 48". Our garage studs appear to be 28" apart nearest the door. I had to get creative with the install. Installed the vertical members on 2 studs 56" apart with the members as far in as they would go. Then instead of a 3rd bar across the back, I used 3 of the adjustable bars in 2 places across the bottom instead of 2. I did have to use a pipe cutter and cut the threaded end off one of the pipes. It seems to hold just fine, though not ideal an install. Good price. Hard to complain.
customer_reviews.author: B review

customer_reviews.title: Great Racks with serious cool factor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these racks. One holds all four of my Chevy 2500 HD tires and wheels (which probably maxes out the load tolerance) and the other holds my Saturn Vue's summer tires and wheels and the spare for my boat trailer. My nephew said it "seriously raised the cool factor" of my garage. The units are sturdy, well build and the lags supplied are perfectly adequate to hold the weight. DO NOT over tighten or strip upon installation. If you do, stop, run to the hardware store, and purchase the next size up in lags. The units save a lot of floor space and keep the tires and wheels where I need them.
customer_reviews.author: WindyHillWoman

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty but a bit shoddy on craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product concept at a decent price. Would have given 5 stars except the bottom tire support bars came with rust bubbles under the painted rods. The integrity of the rack isn't impacted for now but it may be in the future. I'll eventually sand and repaint but it works very well for the intended purpose. Instructions could have been more helpful if they included suggested mounting positions based on tire sizes for the cross bars that hold the tires as well as the back bar that keeps them from hitting the wall. Trial and error works but is unnecessary as the optimal mounting positions for the cross bars is defined by the tire size.
customer_reviews.author: Notfastenuf

customer_reviews.title: The rack is very nice. It's sturdy and looks good
customer_reviews.text: The rack is very nice. It's sturdy and looks good. The instructions are easy to follow and the unit is simple to install. I give the product 4 starts but I give Amazon one star on this one. This product was clearly a returned item that did not even get looked at before sending back out. All the zip ties were cut and wrapping off . The hardware was loose all over the box. The protective Styrofoam was in tiny pieces all over the box. This is completely unacceptable. I would return it and buy it from a different store if I didn't need it today.
customer_reviews.author: Angie M.

customer_reviews.title: Great value if you don't mind scratches.
customer_reviews.text: Strong, sturdy product. It works well when bolted into studs. The bolts that go into the round support bars didn't go in easy, use some kind of grease or lubricating oil on the bolts before trying to get them in. The only reason it didn't get five stars is because there were scrapes on the red frames down to the bare metal. The price made it so this didn't really matter. Just put some anti-corrosion oil on the bare metal spots or paint over if you want. The angles aren't going to be very true so just eyeball it when putting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful garage rack - does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Great rack overall. Does the job. No scratches or quality flaws as others have reported. My only complaint is the telescoping bars - they do flex slightly as the telescope pieces are not precisely made and flex because of the gap between the tubes.

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Save money and build your own out of wood. It takes 3 2x4's and the store will cut each one. The problem with this unit for me was that a wall stud wasn't available in the one corner I wanted to mount this. Made it useless. It seems flimsy, also.
customer_reviews.author: Charger 68

customer_reviews.title: The product is sturdy and easy to install (despite the misleading and incorrect ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding solution to tire storage. The product is sturdy and easy to install (despite the misleading and incorrect instructions). It appears they have solved the shipping issues that many reviewers mentioned. My box was delivered without issues and the contents were secured with large tie wraps and protected with padding. I would recommend adding washers to the lag bolts for a more secure fastening to the wall studs. Mounting above forehead height will eliminate any injury potential, and BTW, the lag bolts are 1/2" not the 7/16" the directions indicate.
customer_reviews.author: EKM

customer_reviews.title: Best quality in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: These are very high quality tire racks. I was a little concerned about the build quality as my car was to be parked underneath both racks. They have four (4) two (2) hole flanges that attach to studs. The width is adjustable, so your able to catch studs. Heavy duty powder coat stands up well. I hold 4 20" wheels with tires, and a set of 4 18" on the other rack. Have had these up for over three years, with no issues. Would purchase again if need be
customer_reviews.author: Erik Holmberg

customer_reviews.title: nice tire rack
customer_reviews.text: nice tire rack,not flimsy or weak, i have two of these in my shop and all is good, only downside is the brackets that are welded on each corner are not straight. hence 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: stingrey

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: exactly as described, good price,holds all 4 of my 22inch wheels, no problem
customer_reviews.author: Olin D

customer_reviews.title: but otherwise a great product. Holds four vehicle tires w/ wheels and ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish the leading edges didn't hurt the head so much when being struck, but otherwise a great product. Holds four vehicle tires w/ wheels and two motorcycle tires without issue. Very happy to finally have the tires off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Motorcycoholic

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the price. Yes it's not perfect cosmetically, but it's not bad at all. Just under the paint in some places you can tell they painted over welds or imperfect painting was done. But it looks just fine, and it's for a garage. Very easy to hang and assemble. I did pull-ups on it after installing and it was rock solid. Now it's holding 4 wheels & tires and looks as good as a tire rack can look!
customer_reviews.author: carrerascott

customer_reviews.title: The weld looked good and clean and nothing bent
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived with the cable ties holding the support rods broken, as many others have reported. However no actual damage or paint scraping was evident. The weld looked good and clean and nothing bent. Holds 4 tires/rims exactly like the pics (08 GT500 OEM rims/tires) with a slight bowing in the middle from the weight. I did use washers under the lag screws as others have suggested.
customer_reviews.author: Raoul Duke

customer_reviews.title: If you are drilling into cement wall...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome, but be warned the hardware is for dry wall and wood frames... if you are putting on cement wall you will need different anchors... with the anchors we bought at Home Depot red line sleeve anchor 5/16 diameter and 1.5 length seems to hold just fine. There are you tube videos on putting the anchors in correctly... research the how to.
customer_reviews.author: Alida C.  Ault

customer_reviews.title: Does the duty
customer_reviews.text: took some tinkering to get it together but it works rl
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Good solution for tire storage.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and a good value for the money. Be sure to mount into studs!! I would not recommend for SUV tires and wheels. Make sure that the tire/wheel combo will clear the ceiling before mounting to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: David Riker

customer_reviews.title: It looks great, and he loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of them for my husband's garage to displays his rims. It's adjustable, and very well built. It looks great, and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Mila

customer_reviews.title: Very good rack.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to store winter tires/wheels for my and my wife's vehicles. I installed them one over the other on some wall studs in the garage. Total installation time for both was about 90 minutes. All the hardware was in the package and the instructions were easy to follow. They seem pretty sturdy and are the best bargain I could find for tire storage.
customer_reviews.author: PJT

customer_reviews.title: Sweet product
customer_reviews.text: After looking for a product to store my winter tires off the garage floor I found this to be the only good answer. It is under rated on all the write-ups I found. It is HEAVY DUTY. The chrome bars are solid steel...not tubing. After mounting it to the wall I find it will easily hold it's rated weight. Nicely finished. Welds are a bit 'half hazard' in spots. The lag bolts need washers that are not supplied. Chrome steel bars were loose in the box and damaged the painted surfaces. Price was lowest on Amazon and free shipping...who can complain?
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking rack, works great.
customer_reviews.text: Rack looks great and is solid. The rods are extremely sturdy and I love the red and metal look. While the rods are adjustable, you must drill into stuff which mean you are restricted on the size of the rack. My rack has about a 10 inch opening after adding 4 tires. Other racks hang on a sliding rack so you can adjust the size.
customer_reviews.author: cp64

customer_reviews.title: This was really easy to install in my garage
customer_reviews.text: This was really easy to install in my garage. I needed to get my summer wheels off the garage floor and this did the job. I can't say that I really cared what it looked like, but it is nicely finished as well. I would consider myself slightly above a novice when it comes to drilling and mounting things and this was easy for me.
customer_reviews.author: PittsburghClint

customer_reviews.title: BUYING ANOTHER
customer_reviews.text: Bought one and it works great. Installation was easy. Red paint is nice. It is currently holding four mounted tires and is not bowing or showing any signs of overweight issues. There is easily room for two more tires on the rack. Parts and instructions are exact. For the money this exceeds my expectations, and I just ordered a second one.
customer_reviews.author: moparjer

customer_reviews.title: Great out of the way storage solution.
customer_reviews.text: Great way to get an extra set of tires out of the way. My car has Michelin PAX run-flats that use a special rim and are pretty expensive. I have a second set mounted on rims that were taking up valuable floor space in my garage. This rack has them up and out of the way and is easily holding close to 250 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Looks good; holds tire/wheels I use
customer_reviews.text: This storage system worked as advertised. In hindsight, I would have purchased one designed to carry most of the weight from a horizontal bar fastened to several studs across the back of the rack rather than two vertical studs. Amazon sells these. But the system I purchased works. Update: In response to a question, I add these pictures.
customer_reviews.author: DAA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Mine did come with the red paint a little beat up, but doesn't affect the sturdy construction or use. It's for my garage, so I didn't care much. Fits my winter tires for my Xterra Off-Road wonderfully. Very little flex in the steel pipes that run lengthwise when putting the tires on. My tires are about 75lbs a piece (I weighed them). Would buy again or recommend to anyone wanting similar set-up.
customer_reviews.author: A. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy and straightforward. Holds my 18" winter wheels with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rack to store my winter tires when my 3 season tires are on my SUV. The HyLoft unit is well made with a nice powder coated red finish and acceptable hardware. The rack went up in about thirty minutes with little fuss and only one repositioning of a lower bar. The lag screws were a little long for my barn, but other than that a flawless installation. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: bensonjon

customer_reviews.title: Could’ve been good
customer_reviews.text: Product was a returned product that had damage from first person who purchased it. Pieces missing and calls to the manufacturer turned disappointing when they didn’t send missing pieces as they stated they would.
customer_reviews.author: sturgesa

customer_reviews.title: I used two
customer_reviews.text: my wheels are wide as hell so I doubled up and built a two section.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: This is sturdy, adjustable
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy, adjustable, and pretty easy to put up. I bought another rack from Tire Rack and it was over $100. This one is better because the bar in the back keeps your tires from messing up the drywall in the garage. The more expensive one from Tire Rack doesn't have a bar in the back, so your tires mark up the wall after a while. I would buy this one again!
customer_reviews.author: john steers

customer_reviews.title: Well built, looks good, easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly to keep tires up off the floor, and out of the way. Helps me maximize my floor space. Looks great in my garage too!
customer_reviews.author: WesArcher

customer_reviews.title: Storing my chrome in style!
customer_reviews.text: Great looking tire rack for my extra set of wheels. Adjusted nicely to perfectly hold a pair of 295's and pair of 225's.
customer_reviews.author: dksirstone

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these after the first one worked as advertised. Puts those extra tires up out of the way, plenty of room for anything unless you drive a Vett or some other 4 foot wide tire patch. Great for everyone else. Bought this over the adjustable because I needed two and the price is much less. Works fine, setup easy, takes a little time with measuring etc but it turns out nice. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stack

customer_reviews.title: Great way to store tires off-season
customer_reviews.text: Very well packaged and easy to install by myself. I currently have 4 wheels/tires and one bicycle on this, roughly 210 lbs. I find this to be a good choice when compared to the more expensive model.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M.

customer_reviews.title: Great to get my 8 snow tires off the garage ...
customer_reviews.text: Great to get my 8 snow tires off the garage floor. Seems to be very sturdy no issues with the paint being chipped off on arrival. Very nicely packaged no issues at all as others have complained about. Would recommend to friends and family members.
customer_reviews.author: js1

customer_reviews.title: Get them up in the air!
customer_reviews.text: I decided on having winter wheels and tires for my new car, and needed a place to store them. Was looking at the various racks offered, and really liked this on from Hyloft. Overall, I was very pleased. Looks great, mounts easy and secure. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Taddeo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice but fixed mounting width. You can find others with a channel system to accommodate different mounting widths.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ganser

customer_reviews.title: It seems to function as described. I was a ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to function as described. I was a bit unsure of the spacing on the bottom supports, but set it up as the box showed, and it seemed to work. The pacers seem a bit flimsy, but hold my set of tires well. Paint was intact, and I had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: J Dub

customer_reviews.title: awesome space saver.
customer_reviews.text: Being a car enthusiast in northern Ohio, I naturally have winter and summer wheels and tires. This rack allows me to keep the off season sets up out of the way, without having to lug them to the basement. I am able to fit 5 18"x7.5" wheels with tires, and still had room for the spare floormats! I may buy a second one since I still have 3 on the floor. Much cheaper than the tirerack option... When installing, be sure to dry set your wheels on the ground so you know where to put the bars. It's hard to adjust once up.
customer_reviews.author: jdolluc

customer_reviews.title: This hangs in our son's garage to store winter or ...
customer_reviews.text: This hangs in our son's garage to store winter or summer tires and keeps them off the ground where they would take up space.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Hornung

customer_reviews.title: Everything I hoped it would be
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice product. It looks very professional and mounted with no issues at all .Very well satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Tom Polansky

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. I didn't have any paint chippage as some reviewers had. I do agree that Hyloft should include 8 flatwashers for the lag bolts. I purchased them for my installation.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect storage for garage
customer_reviews.text: We purchased to store my winter/summer tires in our garage. Was easy to mount and now they are up and out of the way. Love it. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Peggolotta

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these and was impressed by the quality of the product. I thought the bars would be flimsy, but they are actually quite a heavy gauge. The paint was not scratched or messed up at all as per some reviews. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: it worked perfect and I have never had a problem with it
customer_reviews.text: Did not seem heavy enough when I opened the box but once I mounted it on the wall, it worked perfect and I have never had a problem with it!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Myers

customer_reviews.title: Es Installation and looks sturdy. Will see how long it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Es Installation and looks sturdy. Will see how long it lasts. However the instructions said the back bar should be of smaller diameter, all 3 bars in my package were identical.
customer_reviews.author: divemark

customer_reviews.title: Nice but missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: I installed a pair of these racks yesterday. They went up okay but were very sensitive to stud spacing. And, as another reviewer reported, some of the installation hardware was missing. For me it wasn't due to the bag ripping, the 6 washers were just left out of the bag. I'm also not fond of the sharp corners of the frame. With a normal sized car tire, 225/45/17, there's no need for 5 or 6 inches of the width from the wall so the corners are sticking way out unnecessarily. I may cut and weld more forehead-friendly ends on the frame or somebody's gonna get hurt in my garage. Rich
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Looks really good and works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and mounted it to my wall in my motorcycle garage. Looks really good and works well! Just ordered another one!
customer_reviews.author: KristalinaMAM

customer_reviews.title: Very solid rack. Instructions were a bit lacking. ...
customer_reviews.text: Very solid rack. Instructions were a bit lacking. The rack is very adjustable. Make sure to measure your tires and then be sure to place anchors into the studs.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I have a set of snow tires for all of our vehicles so they were always in the way or hard to store. With this Tire Storage rack its simple. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid piece of furniture for your garage wall.
customer_reviews.text: I believe elements which I supposed to receive with this model were out of sync with what instructions listed, however, I still was able to assemble the whole shelf. It is really sturdy and does its job well.
customer_reviews.author: Konrad P. Makowski

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these for 2 sets of snow tires/all season. They fit 4 for our truck and a large car in each and clear the garage up quite a bit. They are really sturdy and were simple to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleP

customer_reviews.title: Have two of these now on the wall of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these now on the wall of the garage. Gets the extra tires out of the way. been over a year with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: EMO

customer_reviews.title: fits at least 4 wheels
customer_reviews.text: This rack looks good and is heavy duty. I have my winter wheels and tires stored on it right now and there is room for probably 2 or 3 more wheels. It installed easily on the wall of my garage and gave me a bit more floor space.
customer_reviews.author: Halle

customer_reviews.title: Great tire rack!!
customer_reviews.text: This tire rack is very sturdy and looks good. Very easy to install, 30-45 mins. I would advise using washers for the lag bolts, heads of the lags are borderline to small for the slots on the side rails. I would absolutely recommend this rack- great value!
customer_reviews.author: Ken--Pittsburgh

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and scary at the same time over your convertible.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you mount this into studs or back it with 2x4's. I have four 275 55R 20's on here and it's pushing the 320lbs mark. It's rated @ 400lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Organizer

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction easy to assemble had it up in <30 min.
customer_reviews.author: KKaye

customer_reviews.title: Easy one person installation and great construction/design.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and install and works great. Perfect for storing winter tires during the summer and vice versa. One person install is possible because of the design.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Functions as Promised.
customer_reviews.text: Well designed, easy to install and got the clutter of my tires off the ground. Would definately purchase another. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: Good product and good value if you don't want to build a tire rack yourself. Installation was easy and fast once I decided where to hang it in the garage. The rods are easy to adjust once the frame ends are attached to the wall. I followed the rod placement from the photo on carton of the box which fit my 225/18 tires nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Bach

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made. Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, well made product. Virtually blemish free upon arrival due to excellent packaging inside the retail box. Very sturdy on wall when installed correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Josh C

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I installed it myself in about1 hr. The only thing i had a problem with was that the paint would rub off on the wall when trying to install it, and talking about the paint, its not very good, it has chipped in several places.. The box it was shipped in was pretty much destroyed when it arrived, but all pieces were present and not damage to the product. I have 4 Tired for a 08 Subaru Forest on the rack right now, and 1 bike, so i am pretty happy with this product, and for the price i would recommend it for any body.
customer_reviews.author: eicoopers

customer_reviews.title: Yes! Looks great and holds my track tires!
customer_reviews.text: I have these holding a set of track wheels/tires for my BMW. Mounting it was pretty paintless and even with 4 wheels (255 width) I still have room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Built strong
customer_reviews.text: Just like described. You can install by yourself. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: mardell s.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for big 18 and 19” suv tires. Works great!!! Very sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Nice tire storage
customer_reviews.text: This storage rack is perfect to get my tires off the garage floor. Good price and took 35 minutes to mount on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Aladin Adad

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a stack of tires in the corner
customer_reviews.text: Much more efficient use of space than just stacking the tires in the corner of the garage. Very happy with purchase. Now if only it came with a motor to slowly spin the bottom rollers like those hot dog machines at the gas station.
customer_reviews.author: Erik B

customer_reviews.title: Nice product !
customer_reviews.text: Item as advertised. Easy to assemble and install. Recommend to others
customer_reviews.author: jimjeeper

customer_reviews.title: Great space savings
customer_reviews.text: Great space savings. We have 4 wheels/tires and 2 bikes off the ground in the garage now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great
customer_reviews.text: I am constantly changing between racing and street tires on my Corvette. This holds both sets very well. The red looks great with my red workbench and tool chests. Installation is a bit of a challenge, but if I made it, you can do it.
customer_reviews.author: Mister_OT

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great product!
customer_reviews.text: Super-easy to install, looks good, works perfectly. What else can I say? Get one - you'll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: ZD

customer_reviews.title: Works great, secure.
customer_reviews.text: This rack works great for my winter tires. (It's now Nov. 2018 and still going strong. ) (And now June 2019. Works good)
customer_reviews.author: Michael Downs

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The hyloft works great easy to install and very flexible.
customer_reviews.author: kevin westfall

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy, would not trust it if a tire could bounce into your car or other garage toys.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great rack
customer_reviews.text: Tire rack worked great - I mounted it up above my cars, and it easily handled 4 SUV tires with room to spare. The only thing I saw that could be better is the paint was chipped on the end pieces - could have been painted better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dininger

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack!
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done! Seems pretty sturdy. Mounted it to concrete with anchor bolts. The finish as a little scuffed and the threads in the cross bars were a bit rough, but all-in-all a very nice rack.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Kite

customer_reviews.title: great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I searched around for a tire storage system that was both sturdy and easy to install. This set fills both needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mr G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my garage
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my garage, although it arrived in a good package, it manage to scratch some of the coating from the red bars with the rods inside the package. Overall, it's very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Tires are out of the way!
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's adjustable and seems to be well made. I was actually able to fit 5 tires on it and 4 of them were mounted to rims.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Clear installation instructions and feels very secure when mounted up. Also the red painted frames go perfect with my red car.
customer_reviews.author: Manpreet

customer_reviews.title: Tire Rack
customer_reviews.text: This product was more than I expected. Great quality, strong and easy to assemble. The instructions are clear with helpful pictures, when I get another set of tires I'll purchase another. Very Happy customer
customer_reviews.author: Leroy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to attach to wall
customer_reviews.text: Easy to attach to wall, holds all 4 race tires with room to spare. Much better than the tires in the way on the ground
customer_reviews.author: Nicole P

customer_reviews.title: Rack for my original tires and rims on the 2013 Dodge Charger
customer_reviews.text: This was a necessity to store my winter tires and wheels. Looks very professional in the garage ! Nice way to keep the tires and wheels off the garage floor !
customer_reviews.author: Gary Steven Blosser

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and mount on garage wall
customer_reviews.text: The Tire Storage System was exactly what I was looking for. It was packaged well and arrived with no damage or scratches. Easy to assemble and mount on garage wall. 9/14
customer_reviews.author: George Foss

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire Rack !!!
customer_reviews.text: This tire rack is a steal for the money! It is very sturdy, easy to install, and looks cool on the wall. A GREAT buy with a seller that provides fantastic communications and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Schomer

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble & install. Packaging was fine. I was surprised how heavy duty it is. The pictures don't do it justice.
customer_reviews.author: K Fish

customer_reviews.title: Great rack
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I need it to do. Holds 4 off-season tires, as well as 2 bikes. Looks great, installation was a breeze. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MIke Grassi

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: ITEM WAS EASY TO INSTALL AND APPEARS TO BE BUILT STURDY ENOUGH TO SUPPORT MY 4 WHEELS AND TIRES WITHOUT A SWEAT! WOULD RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.author: MIKE L

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Easy to install. Holds 5 tires at it's maximum width. Considering buying a second one for other tires!
customer_reviews.author: BigZ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to for one person to install. Supports tires/weight as described.
customer_reviews.author: P. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Read before you buy
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Wasn't able to use. The holes weren't lined up and my husband who is an engineer and his engineer friend couldn't get it to work. So we returned it. It said it was awful and it wasn't worth their effort to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: tjb

product_meta.title: HyLoft Model 01012 Tire-Loft Multi Tire Storage System, 48-Inch wide by 36-Inch Deep,Red
product_meta.description:
The HyLoft 48 in. W Adjustable TireLoft is the ultimate tire storage solution, combining durability with flexibility. Installation is quick and simple - 2 steel end frames attach directly to wall studs on finished or unfinished walls, and support shelf tubes attach to the end frames. The TireLoft's unique design allows it to be adjusted from widths of 36 in. up to 48 in. Perfect for storing seasonal tires, RV tires, track-day tires, and ATV tires, the TireLoft will easily accommodate up to 4 standard vehicle tires. Made entirely of strong, durable steel with a red powder coat finish and chrome support tubes. Holds up to 375 lbs.

AMAZON.COM
The Model 01012 HyLoft Tire Loft Storage System is a great solution for storing seasonal tires, recreational tires or track tires and wheels. The installation is simple. It attaches to the wall studs on finished or unfinished walls. The loft has a maximum width of 48 inches and accommodates various tire sizes up to maximum 36 inches in depth. The loft is made entirely of strong durable steel. The load capacity is 375 pounds when screwed into studs. HyLoft is recognized as an industry leader in garage storage offering unique, easy to use and versatile products to make the garage another fully accessible and organized space in your house. Add more room with little investment.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
